IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE COMMUNITY FOUNDATION IS A PHILANTHROPIC ORGANIZATION THAT MANAGES CHARITABLE FUNDS WITH A BROAD BASE OF DONORS TO BENEFIT THE AREAS OF WESTERN TENNESSEE, EASTERN ARKANSAS, AND NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE COMMUNITY FOUNDATION IS A PHILANTHROPIC ORGANIZATION THAT MANAGES CHARITABLE FUNDS WITH A BROAD BASE OF DONORS TO BENEFIT THE AREAS OF WESTERN TENNESSEE, EASTERN ARKANSAS, AND NORTHERN MISSISSIPPI. SINCE 1969, THE COMMUNITY FOUNDATION OF GREATER MEMPHIS HAS BEEN WORKING WITH DONORS, PROFESSIONAL ADVISORS, AND NONPROFITS TO HELP STRENGTHEN THE COMMUNITY THROUGH STRATEGIC PHILANTHROPY AND COMMUNITY GIVING.
IRS990.Desc: DONOR ADVISED FUNDS:THE FOUNDATION'S PRIMARY PROGRAM IS TO ADMINISTER DONOR ADVISED FUNDS. TO ACCOMPLISH THIS, THE FOUINDATION RECEIVES AND ACCEPTS PROPERTY TO BE USED EXCLUSIVELY FOR RELIGIOUS, CHARITABLE, SCIENTIFIC, LITERARY, OR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES PRIMARILY IN AND FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE COMMUNITY OF MEMPHIS AND SHELBY COUNTY, AND THE VICINITY THEREOF.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: FIELDS OF INTEREST FUNDS:THE FOUNDATION OFFERS FIELD OF INTEREST FUNDS TO SUPPORT SPECIFIC AREAS OF INTEREST, SUCH AS THE ARTS, ENVIRONMENT OR EDUCATION, RATHER THAN AN INDIVIDUAL NONPROFIT ORGANIZATION. THE LARGEST OF THESE FUNDS HOSTED BY THE FOUNDATON WAS THE MID-SOUTH COVID-19 REGIONAL RESPONSE FUND, WHICH PROVIDES FLEXIBLE FUNDING TO ORGANIZATIONS WORKING WITH COMMUNITY MEMBERS WHO HAVE BEEN IMPACTED BY NOVEL CORONAVIRUS AND THE ECONOMIC CONSEQUENCES OF THE OUTBREAK IN OUR REGION OF WEST TENNESSEE, NORTH MISSISSIPPI, AND EASTERN ARKANSAS. THE FUND IS DESIGNED TO COMPLEMENT THE WORK OF PUBLIC HEALTH OFFICIALS AND EXPAND LOCAL CAPACITY TO ADDRESS ALL ASPECTS OF THE OUTBREAK AS EFFICIENTLY AS POSSIBLE.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: NONPROFIT ORGANIZATION DESIGNATED SUPPORT FUNDS:NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS ARE ALLOWED TO ESTABLISH DESIGNATED AGENCY FUNDS WITH THE FOUNDATION. SUCH FUNDS SUPPORT THE WORK OF THE NONPROFIT AND ENABLES ACCESS TO THE MANY SERVICES AND RESOURCES OFFERED BY THE FOUNDATION.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES, TO INCLUDE: GRANTS & INITIATIVES, GIVE365, AND SCHOLARSHIPS. GIVE 365 IS A NEW WAY OF BRINGING CHARITABLE PEOPLE TOGETHER FOR GOOD. GIVE 365 MEMBERS GIVE A MINIMUM OF $1 A DAY OR $ 365 ANNUALLY. BY POOLING SMALLER DONATIONS INTO A CHARITABLE FUND, GIVE 365 MEMBERS ARE ABLE TO MAKE SIGNIFICANT GRANTS THAT IMPROVE OUR COMMUNITY TODAY AND TOMORROW. THAT IS BECAUSE 50 PERCENT OF ALL FUNDS RAISED ARE DISTRIBUTED ANNUALLY, AND 50 PERCENT ARE INVESTED IN AN ENDOWED FUND TO SUPPORT FUTURE GRANTS.GIVE 365 EXPANDING MEMBERSHIP HAS ESTABLISHED A PATTERN OF CHARITABLE GIVING AND A LASTING FUND THAT CONTINUES TO GROW. GIVE 365 IS HARNESSING THE ENERGY, ENTHUSIASM AND RESOURCES OF MEMPHIANS AND CONNECTING LIKE-MINDED PEOPLE WHO WANT TO MAKE A DIFFERENCE. THE FOUNDATION OFFERS A SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM FOR STUDENTS RESIDING IN THE METROPOLITAN MEMPHIS AREA. PRIORITY WILL BE GIVEN TO STUDENTS WHO ARE INVOLVED IN THE COMMUNITY THROUGH VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES.

IRS990ScheduleA.FactsAndCircumstancesTestTxt: THE COMMUNITY FOUNDATION OF GREATER MEMPHIS MEETS THE FACTS AND CIRCUMSTANCES TEST AS FOLLOWS:1. THE FOUNDATION'S PUBLIC SUPPORT PERCENTAGE IS AT LEAST 10%.2. THE FOUNDATION MAINTAINS A CONTINUOUS AND BONAFIDE PROGRAM FOR SOLICITATION OF FUNDS FROM THE GENERAL PUBLIC.3. AT 31.08%, THE FOUNDATION'S PUBLIC SUPPORT PERCENTAGE FOR TAX YEAR 2021 IS WELL ABOVE THE MINIMUM REQUIREMENT OF 10% AND NARROWLY FALLS SHORT OF THE NORMAL REQUIREMENT OF 33.3%.4. THE FOUNDATION NORMALLY RECEIVES SUPPORT FROM A LARGE NUMBER OF UNRELATED DONORS. IN FISCAL YEAR 2022, THE FOUNDATION RECEIVED MORE THAN $200 MILLION IN CONTRIBUTIONS FROM MORE THAN 1,700 INDIVIDUAL DONORS. 5. THE FOUNDATION HAS A GOVERNING BODY WHICH REPRESENTS THE BROAD INTERESTS OF THE PUBLIC. THE BOARD OF GOVERNORS CONSISTS OF "INDIVIDUALS REFLECTING THE COMMUNITY INTEREST." THE BOARD IS WELL-QUALIFIED WITH DIVERSE BACKGROUNDS, SKILL SETS AND PERSPECTIVES. PLEASE VISIT THE FOUNDATION'S WEBSITE FOR MORE INFORMATION ON THE BOARD MEMBERS: HTTPS://WWW.CFGM.ORG/BOARD.6. THE FOUNDATION'S PROVIDES SERVICES AND FACILITIES DIRECTLY FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE GENERAL PUBLIC ON A CONTINUING BASIS. FOR MORE INFORMATION HIGHLIGHTING THE SERVICES AND COMMUNITY ORIENTATION, PLEASE VISIT: HTTPS://WWW.CFGM/IN-OUR-COMMUNITY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FOUNDATION HAS MULTIPLE INTENDED USES FOR ITS ENDOWED FUNDS. THOSE INTENDED USES INCLUDE, BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO, SUPPORTING THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES: SCHOLARSHIPS, MEDICAL RESEARCH GRANTS, OPERATING SUPPORT FOR NONPROFIT ENTITIES, FIELD OF INTEREST FUNDS, AND OTHER CHARITABLE ACTIVITES.

THE FOUNDATION HAS BEEN DETERMINED TO BE EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL AND STATE INCOME TAXES UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE AS EVIDENCED BY A DETERMINATION LETTER DATED AUGUST 22, 1990. ADDITIONALLY, THE FOUNDATION HAS BEEN DETERMINED TO BE AN ORGANIZATION THAT IS NOT A PRIVATE FOUNDATION. THE FOUNDATION HAS DETERMINED THAT IT DOES NOT HAVE ANY MATERIAL UNRECOGNIZED TAX POSITION AS OF APRIL 30, 2022 AND 2021.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FOUNDATION MONITORS ITS GRANTS IN VARIOUS WAYS DEPENDING ON THE SOURCE OF THE FUNDING. THERE ARE 3 PRIMARY FUNDING SOURCES WHICH ARE DONOR ADVISED FUNDS, PROGRAM/DISCRETIONARY, AND SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS. DONOR ADVISED FUND GRANTS: GRANTS FROM DONOR ADVISED FUNDS ARE OVERSEEN BY A GRANT MANAGER. THE GRANT MANAGER REVIEWS THE GRANT RECOMMENDATION FORM TO ENSURE ACCURACY AND PROPRIETY AND VERIFIES THE RECOMMENDED GRANTEE IS A CHARITABLE ORGANIZATION UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. ALL GRANT REQUESTS ARE THEN SUBSEQUENTLY APPROVED FOR DISBURSEMENT BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE, AND ULTIMATELY, RATIFIED BY THE FULL BOARD. THE GRANTEE'S USE OF THE FUNDS IS MONITORED BY FOUNDATION STAFF UNTIL COMPLETION OF THE DESIGNATED PURPOSES. PROGRAM/DISCRETIONARY GRANTS: THE RESPECTIVE COMMITTEE WILL SET FORTH CRITERIA FOR AWARDING EACH PROGRAM-RELATED GRANT. FURTHER, THE COMMITTEE WILL REVIEW AND EVALUATE APPLICATIONS TO ENSURE A CHARITABLE PURPOSE. SUBSEQUENT TO THE GRANT DISBURSEMENT, FOUNDATION STAFF WILL OVERSEE BUDGETS AND WORKPLANS TO ENSURE APPROPRIATE USE OF FUNDS. SCHOLARSHIPS: SCHOLARSHIPS ARE BASED ON CERTAIN SELECTION CRITERIA, INCLUDING THE FOLLOWING: ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE; EXTRACURRICULAR ACTIVITIES, INCLUDING COMMUNITY SERVICES; LETTERS OF REFERENCE; WORK EXPERIENCE; CAREER AND EDUCATIONAL GOALS; AND FINANCIAL NEED. AN INDEPENDENT SELECTION COMMITTEE REVIEWS ALL SCHOLARSHIP APPLICATIONS. SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS ARE PAID DIRECTLY TO THE EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTION.
ALEX HOLTEL RECEIVED ONE YEAR'S PAY AS SEVERANCE AT THE TIME OF HIS DEPARTURE IN OCTOBER OF 2021.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FOUNDATION DISTRIBUTES THE FORM 990 RETURN TO ITS DIRECTORS VIA EMAIL PRIOR TO ITS FILING. THE DIRECTORS REVIEW IT AND RESPOND TO THE TREASURER WITH ANY QUESTIONS OR CONCERNS. IF THE TREASURER DOES NOT HAVE ANY UNANSWERED INQUIRIES AFTER A REASONABLE PERIOD OF TIME, THEN HE WILL CONSIDER THIS AS APPROVAL FOR THE FORM 990 TO BE FILED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FOUNDATION HAS A WRITTEN CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY. ON AN ANNUAL BASIS, ALL DIRECTORS ARE REQUIRED TO REVIEW THE POLICY AND SIGN IT TO ACKNOWLEDGE INTENT ON COMPLIANCE. IN THE EVENT OF A CONFLICT, THE CONFLICTED PERSON IS RECUSED FROM ALL DISCUSSION AND ANY VOTE ON THE MATTER INVOLVED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COMPENSATION FOR THE PRESIDENT IS DETERMINED BY THE INDEPENDENT EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE. COMPENSATION FOR ALL OTHER EMPLOYEES IS DETERMINED BY THE PRESIDENT AND IS BASED ON JOB PERFORMANCE, SALARY COMPARABILITY STUDIES AND OTHER ECONOMIC FACTORS. FOR ALL POSITIONS, THE MEAN AND MEDIAN SALARY FOR THE MOST SIMILAR POSITION AS DEFINED BY THE COUNCIL ON FOUNDATION'S SALARY SURVEY IS CONSULTED. DISCUSSIONS REGARDING SALARIES ARE DOCUMENTED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 18
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FOUNDATION'S FORM 990 RETURN IS MAINTAINED IN THE ORGANIZATION'S OFFICE. THIS DOCUMENT IS AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FOUNDATION'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, POLICIES, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE MAINTAINED IN THE ORGANIZATION'S OFFICE. THESE DOCUMENTS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST. ADDITIONALLY, SOME GOVERNING DOCUMENTS CAN BE OBTAINED AT THE ORGANIZATION'S WEBSITE.
CSV INCOME 68,103. TRANSFERS TO RELATED PARTIES 16,002,309.
THE PROCESS FOR OVERSITE OF THE AUDIT HAS NOT CHANGED FROM THE PREVIOUS YEAR.
